ref: 6619 *drapp ʻ press ʼ. [→ Psht. drabəl ʻ to press down ʼ (rather than, with EVP 22, ← *dabb -- for which no NIA. forms attest dr -- ). But both MIA. and NIA. forms may be conn. w. darpá -- , darpáyati, dŕ̊pyati (with semantic development ʻ excitement -- arrogance -- oppression <-> force ʼ) or at least have collided with them or have been affected by meaning of forms of *dabb -- ]
P. dap(p)aṭ, ḍapaṭ m. ʻ rebuke ʼ, dapaṭṇā, ḍa˚ ʻ to rebuke ʼ;
N. dapkāunu ʻ to rebuke ʼ, dapoṭ ʻ hiding ʼ;
A. dāpiba ʻ to control, reprove ʼ, dapāliba ʻ to rebuke ʼ;
Mth. dāpab ʻ to press, squeeze ʼ;
H. dāp m. ʻ stamping forcibly, strength ʼ, dapaṭnā ʻ to rebuke ʼ;
M. dāpṇẽ ʻ to menace ʼ, dapṇẽ ʻ to lie hid ʼ, dapaṭṇẽ ʻ to cram in, menace ʼ. --
Pk. dappa -- m. ʻ force ʼ and
S. ḍrapu m. ʻ fear ʼ rather < darpá -- . --
Wg. dr̥p -- ʻ to copulate (of a man) ʼ poss. but less likely < dŕ̊pyati.
